intro: Eleutherospermum lazicum, commonly known as Lazic's eleutherospermum, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered inflorescences and small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
